intro: Xylopicrum dicarpum, commonly known as the two-seed woodplant, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its unique feature is the presence of two seeds per fruit, giving it the specific epithet "dicarpum." Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Xylopicrum dicarpum is considered a vulnerable species.
